summary: This document is an email chain from August 2019 between attorneys representing alleged victims of Jeffrey Epstein and a federal prosecutor. The emails discuss scheduling interviews for two clients who believe they were assaulted by Epstein in 2004, and they inquire about the status of the investigation following Epstein's death. Attachments include photographs of the clients from 2004.

persons.name: Colleen Mullen
persons.context: Attorney corresponding with federal prosecutors to schedule interviews for her clients who are alleged victims of Jeffrey Epstein. She inquires about the investigation status after Epstein's death.

persons.name: Teri Gibbs
persons.context: Attorney corresponding with federal prosecutors to schedule interviews for clients who are alleged victims of Jeffrey Epstein. She provides availability details and mentions that another attorney, Arick Fudali, will accompany one client.

persons.name: Arick Fudali
persons.context: New York attorney mentioned as accompanying one of the alleged victims (Ms. [redacted]) to her interview with prosecutors.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the criminal investigation (19 Cr. 490 (RMB)). The emails discuss victim reports against him for alleged assaults in 2004, and reference his recent passing.

persons.name: Lisa Bloom
persons.context: Attorney copied on the initial email from Teri Gibbs to the prosecutors regarding victim reports against Jeffrey Epstein.

connections.description: Attorneys working together at the same firm, coordinating on scheduling client interviews with prosecutors.
Attorneys working together; Teri Gibbs states that Arick Fudali will accompany a client to an interview.
Both are copied on emails regarding victim representation and scheduling.
Lisa Bloom is copied on Teri Gibbs's initial email to prosecutors about victim reports.
Mullen is an attorney representing alleged victims of Epstein, corresponding with prosecutors about the case against him.

events.title: Alleged assaults by Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Two clients of the attorneys believe they were assaulted by Jeffrey Epstein in or around June 2004.

events.title: Initial call between attorneys and prosecutors
events.description: Attorneys Teri Gibbs and colleagues spoke with federal prosecutors regarding their clients' victim reports against Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein passed away over the weekend prior to August 12, 2019. This event prompts the attorneys to inquire about the status of the criminal investigation.

events.title: Scheduled interview with victim Ms. [redacted]
events.description: Proposed in-person interview at 12 p.m. with one alleged victim, to be accompanied by attorney Arick Fudali.

events.title: Scheduled video conference with victim Ms. [redacted]
events.description: Proposed video conference at 5 p.m. EST with another alleged victim who is located in Japan.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Two alleged victims of Jeffrey Epstein, represented by attorneys, reported assaults occurring in or around June 2004.
The correspondence occurs shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's death in August 2019, with attorneys seeking confirmation that the investigation into potential co-conspirators is ongoing.
Attorneys provided photographs of the clients from 2004 to prosecutors and asked if the clients appeared in any photographs seized from Epstein's home.
Interviews were scheduled for late August 2019: one in-person in New York and one via video conference for a victim located in Japan.
The email chain involves coordination between victim attorneys (Colleen Mullen, Teri Gibbs, Arick Fudali, Lisa Bloom) and federal prosecutors from the Southern District of New York.
